timeline.message:
Fix AMPL reader and writer for ThreeWindingsTransformer.

Signed-off-by: Anne Tilloy <anne.tilloy@rte-france.com>

Fix AMPL reader and writer for ThreeWindingsTransformer.

Signed-off-by: Anne Tilloy <anne.tilloy@rte-france.com>

timeline.bodyText: 2 times LEG3_SUFFIX. I bet the first one is LEG2_SUFFIX, else it is redundant.
timeline.author: nomont

timeline.message:
Fix network writer with new phase tap changer objects.

Signed-off-by: Anne Tilloy <anne.tilloy@rte-france.com>

Non linear shunt are considered as one section shunt.

Signed-off-by: Anne Tilloy <anne.tilloy@rte-france.com>

timeline.bodyText: Maybe log that we only disconnect the shunt but don't do anything else
timeline.author: MioRtia

replies.bodyText: Yes okay. Indeed at that stage of the PR, I have converted a non linear shunt as a one section shunt. The AMPL tool has the options: use the shunt as it is or disconnect it. I think that we have to improve the conversion but I am not able to do it by myself.
replies.author: annetill

timeline.bodyText: You can delete these lines (not comment them)
timeline.author: MioRtia

timeline.bodyText: I'm surprised by the end of this statement: what happen if id endsWith LEG1 or LEG3 ?
timeline.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText: I add a test and make a fix. Just tell me if it is okay for you.
replies.author: annetill

timeline.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText: :-) I have put a TODO instead. I need help to continue with non linear shunts!
replies.author: annetill

timeline.bodyText:
Are you sure that the g2/b2 (resp. g3/b3) are exported at the good side. Looking to the column names, we have: r, x, g1, g2, b1, b2.
It seems that the side1 is always a read end, and the side2 is the middleBus, so I agree with your implementation, but I'm not totally confident and want to be sure it's OK
timeline.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText: I think that 1 and 2 are respectively the left side of the serie impedance and the right side of the serie impedance. So, I put everything on the left side (=network side). It is okay for you ?
replies.author: annetill

replies.bodyText: On tuesday, we discuss about it with @MioRtia: if the scheme of the website, I totally agree with your proposal
replies.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText: I would move the initialization inside the if block.
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText: Why the code is different for the two models: the getMaximumSectionCount is defined in the ShuntCompensator interface, so I guess that points should have the same value.
timeline.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText: Because at this stage, I am making an approximation for non linear shunts. We have to model non linear shunt as rtc and ptc and I think that we have to introduce a new format in the ampl converter. @MioRtia will help me for that but maybe later.
replies.author: annetill

timeline.bodyText: Is this sufficient to test everything you change in this PR?
timeline.author: mathbagu
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -101,6 +111,19 @@ public void writeBattery() throws IOException {
     @Test
     public void writeThreeWindingsTransformer() throws IOException {
         Network network = ThreeWindingsTransformerNetworkFactory.createWithCurrentLimits();
+        network.getThreeWindingsTransformer("3WT").getLeg1()
+                .newPhaseTapChanger()
+                .beginStep()
+                .setRho(1)
+                .setR(0.1)
+                .setX(1.)
+                .setB(0.)
+                .setG(0.)
+                .setAlpha(0)
+                .endStep()
+                .setTapPosition(0)
+                .setLowTapPosition(0)
+                .add();

timeline.message:
* Add unit test.
* Fixes after review comments.

Signed-off-by: Anne Tilloy <anne.tilloy@rte-france.com>

* Add unit tests.
* Section count is not updated for nonlinear shunt.
* Fixes.

Signed-off-by: Anne Tilloy <anne.tilloy@rte-france.com>

Add methods to get all legs

Signed-off-by: Mathieu BAGUE <mathieu.bague@rte-france.com>

Refactoring.
Small fix for current limit side of a three windings transformer.

Signed-off-by: Anne Tilloy <anne.tilloy@rte-france.com>

Increase code coverage

Signed-off-by: Mathieu BAGUE <mathieu.bague@rte-france.com>
